Articles.Content:
Hi there. Got the game on the Steam sale, first post on these forums, of course it had to be a question, hope you guys can help me out!

I'm trying to figure out how I can access more information on celestial bodies without resorting to the wiki or other out-of-game resources. So far, I've gone as far as Minmus, but I'm getting to the point where I want to start exploring other planets. However, without knowing what gravitational forces and atmospheric pressure I'm dealing with, I can't really design an exploration vessel and set its course. I've tried looking for the atmospheric scan results of the bodies I've visited, but I can find no such thing.

So, after scouring the internet trying to figure out how I can gather information about my next destination without spoiling the entire adventure, I resort to you good folks! Can anybody tell me if it is possible to figure out a planet's diameter and atmospheric pressure, in order to set a course for scanning and eventual landing, and if so, how I do it?

Cheers!

Go to the tracking station (or map view if you're currently flying a ship). Zoom way out until you can see the other planets. Click on the one you're curious about and select "focus view". On the right side of the screen there are a few buttons that pop up. Click on one of those (can't remember exactly which one) and you will get more detailed information about that planet/moon.
I just checked that out. I never knew that was there!
You'll need to send a probe to get atmosphere information, but as said above you can access the basic information by going to the map and focusing on the planet in question.
Thank you. Goddamn, I', glad I cam do this without any more spoilers! Now to figure out resource harvesting and aeroplanes! Cheers!
